hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 20-day realized volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) while the market is in NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent expansion will trigger a directional regime shift within 5 trading days, with the direction determined by the breakout relative to the compression range midpoint.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression often precedes significant directional moves. In neutral regimes, this compression represents equilibrium that's vulnerable to catalyst-driven breaks. The 20th percentile threshold identifies meaningful compression events.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of 100-day rolling window
BTC price breaks above/below compression range (20-day high/low) with >1.5% move

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BULL/BEAR with >70% confidence
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns to compression range midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts fail to sustain >70% of the time, or compression periods extend beyond 5 days without directional resolution.
